title: Fever with yellow eyes
guideline: Fever with yellowing of eyes may indicate liver involvement. In triage, assess duration, presence of dark urine, pale stools, abdominal pain, and fatigue. Encourage rest, hydration, and avoiding alcohol or unsafe remedies. Refer if jaundice with fever persists or worsening.
safe_actions: Monitor urine color and stool changes

title: High BP in pregnancy
guideline: Raised blood pressure during pregnancy may pose a risk of complications. Assess headache, visual disturbances, swelling, and upper abdominal pain. Encourage calm environment, reduce stressors, and monitor symptoms. Immediate referral if severe headache, vision issues, or very high BP.

title: Chest pain in adult
guideline: Chest pain with sweating, breathlessness, or radiation to arm may indicate cardiac risk. Keep the person calm, limit exertion, and monitor breathing. Immediate referral.

title: Severe dehydration
guideline: Dry mouth, sunken eyes, very low urine output, and dizziness indicate possible severe dehydration and electrolyte imbalance. Encourage oral rehydration solution (ORS) and shade. Refer urgently if lethargic or unable to drink.

title: High fever in child
guideline: High fever in a child for more than two days may indicate infection risk. Tepid sponging, hydration, and rest are safe steps. Refer if persistent high fever, convulsions, lethargy, or poor feeding.

title: Prolonged cough with weight loss
guideline: Cough lasting more than two weeks with weight loss may indicate a pulmonary risk. Encourage mask use to protect others, improve ventilation, and hydration. Refer for evaluation.
safe_actions: Use a clean cloth or mask

title: Watery diarrhea
guideline: Watery diarrhea may lead to dehydration. Encourage ORS, clean water, and hand hygiene. Refer if persistent, blood in stool, or signs of dehydration.

title: Heat stroke
guideline: Extreme heat exposure may cause heat stroke with confusion or fainting. Move to shade, cool with wet cloth, and give small sips of water if conscious. Immediate referral.
safe_actions: Give small sips of water if conscious

title: Hypothermia in elderly
guideline: Cold exposure in elderly may cause shivering, confusion, and cold skin. Warm with blankets and warm environment. Refer if confusion or worsening.

title: Snakebite
guideline: Possible snakebite requires keeping the person still, immobilizing the limb, and removing tight clothing or jewelry. Do not cut or suck the wound. Immediate referral.
safe_actions: Remove tight items near the bite

title: Pesticide exposure
guideline: Exposure to agricultural chemicals may cause nausea, dizziness, or breathing difficulty. Move to fresh air, remove contaminated clothing, and wash skin with clean water. Immediate referral if breathing issues.

title: Animal bite
guideline: Animal bite may risk infection. Wash wound with clean water and soap, keep it covered, and refer for evaluation.
safe_actions: Wash wound with clean water and soap

title: Burn injury
guideline: Burns require cooling with clean cool water, avoiding ice or ointments, and keeping the area clean and loosely covered. Refer for large or deep burns.

title: Vaginal bleeding in pregnancy
guideline: Bleeding during pregnancy is a red flag. Encourage lying on side, minimize movement, and avoid stressors. Immediate referral.

title: Neonatal yellowing of skin
guideline: Yellowing of skin in a newborn may indicate jaundice. Encourage feeding, keep baby warm, and monitor sleepiness. Refer if worsening or poor feeding.

title: Leg swelling with breathlessness
guideline: Swollen legs with breathlessness may indicate circulatory risk. Encourage rest, elevate legs, and limit exertion. Refer urgently if breathless at rest.

title: Convulsions
guideline: Convulsions require keeping the area safe, turning the person to the side after convulsion stops, and avoiding putting anything in the mouth. Immediate referral.
safe_actions: Turn to side after convulsion stops

title: Unconscious person
guideline: Unconsciousness is a red flag. Check breathing, keep airway clear, place in recovery position if breathing, and refer immediately.
safe_actions: Place in recovery position if breathing

title: Severe bleeding
guideline: Severe bleeding requires applying firm pressure with a clean cloth, elevating the bleeding area if possible, and immediate referral.
safe_actions: Apply firm pressure with clean cloth

title: Ankle sprain
guideline: Ankle sprain presents with pain and swelling after twisting injury. Rest, elevation, and cool compress are safe steps. Refer if unable to bear weight.
